title: LEGALIGHT Mock Test 07 - CLAT 2026
description: Full-length CLAT mock test with 120 questions across 5 sections

passages.title: The Eyes Have It - Ruskin Bond
passages.content: I had the train compartment to myself up to Rohana, then a girl got in... As I was totally blind at the time, my eyes sensitive only to light and darkness, I was unable to tell what the girl looked like...

passages.title: Kafan - Munshi Premchand
passages.content: Outside the door of the hut, father and son sat silently in front of a dying fire, while inside, the son's young wife Budhiya was writhing in labor pains...

passages.title: Coming Out As Dalit - Yashica Dutt
passages.content: As a young girl growing up in Ajmer, journalist and author Yashica Dutt says that she was painfully aware of the many sacrifices her mother made...

passages.title: POCSO Legal Dilemma
passages.content: With the increasing incidents of sexual offenses against children in India, there has been growing concern over safeguarding their well-being...

passages.title: Legal Aid Services - Article 39-A
passages.content: Article 39-A of the Constitution mandates free legal aid to ensure equal justice for all citizens. The Legal Services Authorities Act, 1987 established NALSA...

passages.title: Judicial Impeachment Procedure
passages.content: Articles 124 and 217 of the Constitution provide for removal of Supreme Court and High Court judges for 'proved misbehaviour or incapacity' through impeachment...

passages.title: Cybercrime Law and Banking Fraud
passages.content: In 2024, India witnessed unprecedented cybercrime with losses of Rs 22,845.73 crore, representing a 206% increase from Rs 7,465.18 crore in 2023...

passages.title: Indian Contract Act - Formation and Capacity
passages.content: The Indian Contract Act, 1872 defines a contract as 'an agreement enforceable by law' under Section 2(h)...

passages.title: Contract Damages and Remedies
passages.content: Section 73 of the Indian Contract Act, 1872 establishes the fundamental principle that when a contract is breached, the party who suffers is entitled to compensation...

passages.title: Democracy vs Electoral Autocracy
passages.content: In 2024, over 60 countries held national elections, encompassing nearly half of the world's population... Yet beneath this surface, troubling realities persist...

passages.title: Human-Tiger Conflict in India
passages.content: The escalating human-tiger conflict in India has emerged as one of the most pressing challenges facing wildlife conservation today...

passages.title: Unorganized Workers Welfare
passages.content: Despite numerous government initiatives and welfare schemes, India's unorganized workers continue to face systemic barriers in accessing basic social security benefits...

passages.title: Spirit of Cricket vs Modern Competition
passages.content: Cricket stands at a crossroads between preserving its genteel traditions and embracing the ruthless competitiveness of modern professional sport...
